questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
**Equations:**
$$ax^{2}=bx-6$$
$$kx^{2}+11x=m$$
**Information:**
Sum and difference of the roots are 7/2 and 1/2 respectively.
If A and B are the smaller and larger roots, then $$A-B=-13/3$$.
One of the roots is -2 times of the larger root of the equation I.

Which of the following equations gives equal roots:
options: More than one option gives equal roots
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$ax^{2}-bx+6=0$$
Let A and B are larger and smaller roots respectively.
$$A+B=7/2$$
$$A-B=1/2$$
$$A=4/2=2$$
$$B=2-1/2=3/2$$
$$b=7$$
$$a=2$$

$$kx^{2}+11x-m=0$$
Let C and D be the larger and smaller roots
$$D=2x-2=-4$$
$$C=-4+13/3=1/3$$
$$k=3$$
$$m=4$$

1. $$(a/2)x^{2}=2mx-(2b+2)$$
$$x^{2}-8x+16=0$$
$$roots=+4,+4$$

2. $$(m/2a)x^{2}=mx-(k+1)$$
$$x^{2}-4x+4=0$$
$$roots=+2,+2$$

3. $$(m+k)x^{2}=2m-4$$
$$7x^{2}-8+4=0$$
$$x^{2}=4/7$$
It gives improper and unequal roots.
Hence, option C is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
**Equations:**
$$6x^{2}=kx+6$$
$$mx^{2}+kx+1=0$$
**Information:**
One of the roots is 3/2. Value of (3-2B) is 5/3. -B is the negative root of the equation.
Sum of the roots is equally distant from 0 as the sum of the roots of first equation.

Find the value of (m-k).
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$6x^{2}-kx-6=0$$
Positive root = 3/2
Sum of roots = k/6
$$k/6=3/2-B$$
$$k/6=(3-2B)/2$$
$$k/3=5/3$$
$$k=5$$
Equation: $$6x^{2}-5x-6=0$$
roots = +3/2, -2/3
$$B=2/3$$

Equation:
$$mx^{2}+kx+1=0$$
$$mx^{2}+5x+1=0$$
Sum of roots = -5/6
$$-5/m=-5/6$$
$$m=6$$

Required = 6-5 = 1
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
**Equations:**
$$6x^{2}=kx+6$$
$$mx^{2}+kx+1=0$$
**Information:**
One of the roots is 3/2. Value of (3-2B) is 5/3. -B is the negative root of the equation.
Sum of the roots is equally distant from 0 as the sum of the roots of first equation.

Find the value of $$(k+m-B)$$.

Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
**Equations:**
$$6x^{2}=kx+6$$
$$mx^{2}+kx+1=0$$
**Information:**
One of the roots is 3/2. Value of (3-2B) is 5/3. -B is the negative root of the equation.
Sum of the roots is equally distant from 0 as the sum of the roots of first equation.

If C and D are larger and smaller roots of the second equation, then find C-D.

Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
**Note:**
Any one of the equation gives rational roots and other equation gives irrational roots.
$$(k^{2}-4M=9)$$
Value of k is a prime number less than 23 and more than 13. No equation has roots equal to +10.
Value of N is 2 more than smaller root of the equation I.

Find the value of (M-k).
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
If the discriminant is whole, then it gives rational and real roots.
$$\sqrt{k^{2}-4M}=3$$
Means it gives two rational roots.
Possible value of k=17 and 19
If k=17
$$289-4M=9$$
$$M=70$$
$$x^{2}-17x+70=0$$
Roots = 10, 7
Not possible because root is not equal to 10

If k=19
$$361-4M=9$$
$$M=88$$
$$x^{2}-19x+88=0$$
Roots=11 and 8
Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
$$N=8+2=10$$
$$12x^{2}+23x+10=0$$
Roots = -2/3, -5/4
Required = 88-19=69
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
**Note:**
Any one of the equation gives rational roots and other equation gives irrational roots.
$$(k^{2}-4M=9)$$
Value of k is a prime number less than 23 and more than 13. No equation has roots equal to +10.
Value of N is 2 more than smaller root of the equation I.

Which of the following is are correct about the roots of first equation:
I: Both are even number.
II: Both are negative.
III: Difference of the roots are 3.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
If the discriminant is whole, then it gives rational and real roots.
$$\sqrt{k^{2}-4M}=3$$
Means it gives two rational roots.
Possible value of k=17 and 19
If k=17
$$289-4M=9$$
$$M=70$$
$$x^{2}-17x+70=0$$
Roots = 10, 7
Not possible because root is not equal to 10

If k=19
$$361-4M=9$$
$$M=88$$
$$x^{2}-19x+88=0$$
Roots=11 and 8

Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
$$N=8+2=10$$
$$12x^{2}+23x+10=0$$
Roots = -2/3, -5/4

I: Both are even number. (Both are not even)
II: Both are negative. (Both are positive)
III: Difference of the roots are 3. (Required = 11-8=3)
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
**Note:**
Any one of the equation gives rational roots and other equation gives irrational roots. $$(k^{2}-4M=9)$$
Value of k is a prime number less than 23 and more than 13. No equation has roots equal to +10.
Value of N is 2 more than smaller root of the equation I.

Find the product of smaller roots of both equations.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$x^{2}=kx-M$$
If the discriminant is whole, then it gives rational and real roots.
$$\sqrt{k^{2}-4M}=3$$
Means it gives two rational roots.
Possible value of k=17 and 19
If k=17
$$289-4M=9$$
$$M=70$$
$$x^{2}-17x+70=0$$
Roots = 10, 7
Not possible because root is not equal to 10

If k=19
$$361-4M=9$$
$$M=88$$
$$x^{2}-19x+88=0$$
Roots=11 and 8

Equation II: $$12x^{2}+(k+4)x+N=0$$
$$N=8+2=10$$
$$12x^{2}+23x+10=0$$
Roots = -2/3, -5/4
Required = $$-5/4\times8=-10$$
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
**Note:**
Roots of first equation are equal and real. Roots of other equation is real but not equal.
Value of n is even and more than 23 but less than 34. Any one root of equation II is rational.
Ratio of the value of k and m is 4:9 respectively.

Find the value of $$(km-n)$$.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
To have equal roots the discriminant have to be 0.
If this equation have equal roots:
4km have to be equal to $$12^{2}$$
$$km=144/4=36$$
$$k:m=4:9$$
Means, k=4, m=9
Roots of the equation: $$4x^{2}-12x+9=0$$
+3/2, +3/2

Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
Roots are not equal but they are real mean discriminant have to be more than 0.
$$n^{2}>16\times9\times4$$
$$n^{2}>576$$
Possible value of n=26,28,30,32
Only If n=32 then we get one rational roots
so, equation will be $$9x^{2}-32x-16=0$$
roots = -4/9, +4
Required = $$4\times9-32=4$$
hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
**Note:**
Roots of first equation are equal and real. Roots of other equation is real but not equal.
Value of n is even and more than 23 but less than 34. Any one root of equation II is rational.
Ratio of the value of k and m is 4:9 respectively.

Which of the following is/are true:
I: Equal roots of equation I is rational roots.
II: One root of second equation is positive rational root.
III: Difference between the co-efficient of $$x^{2}$$ in both equation is more than the value of k.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
To have equal roots the discriminant have to be 0.
If this equation have equal roots:
4km have to be equal to $$12^{2}$$
$$km=144/4=36$$
$$k:m=4:9$$
Means, k=4, m=9
Roots of the equation: $$4x^{2}-12x+9=0$$
+3/2, +3/2

Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
Roots are not equal but they are real mean discriminant have to be more than 0.
$$n^{2}>16\times9\times4$$
$$n^{2}>576$$
Possible value of n=26,28,30,32
Only If n=32, then we get one rational roots
so, equation will be $$9x^{2}-32x-16=0$$
roots = -4/9, +4

I: Equal roots of equation I is rational roots.
Roots = irrational. [Solution states this, though 1.5 is rational. Following provided solution]
II: One root of second equation is positive rational root.
Positive rational roots = +4. Hence, it is correct.
III: Difference between the co-efficient of $$x^{2}$$ in both equation is more than the value of k.
Difference = 9-4=5
Hence, it is also correct.
So, option B is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
**Note:**
Roots of first equation are equal and real. Roots of other equation is real but not equal.
Value of n is even and more than 23 but less than 34. Any one root of equation II is rational.
Ratio of the value of k and m is 4:9 respectively.

Find the product of all positive roots of both equations.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Equation I: $$kx^{2}=12x-m$$
To have equal roots the discriminant have to be 0.
If this equation have equal roots:
4km have to be equal to $$12^{2}$$
$$km=144/4=36$$
$$k:m=4:9$$
Means, k=4, m=9
Roots of the equation: $$4x^{2}-12x+9=0$$
+3/2, +3/2

Equation II: $$9x^{2}-nx-16=0$$
Roots are not equal but they are real mean discriminant have to be more than 0.
$$n^{2}>16\times9\times4$$
$$n^{2}>576$$
Possible value of n=26,28,30,32
Only If n=32, then we get one rational roots
so, equation will be $$9x^{2}-32x-16=0$$
roots = -4/9, +4
Required = $$3/2\times3/2\times4=9$$
hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(8x^{3}+px^{2}+qx=15)$$ If $$A+B+C$$ is $$-1/2$$ then find the value of 'p'. (Note: A, B and C are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Sum of the roots = -b/a
$$-p/8=-1/2$$
$$p=4$$
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(sx^{3}+px^{2}+3x=15)$$ If $$AB+BC+AC=3/8$$, then find the value of 's'. (Note: A, B and C are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$AB+BC+AC=c/a$$
$$3/s=3/8$$
$$s=8$$
Hence, option B is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(8x^{3}+px^{2}+qx=Z)$$, If product of A, B and C is $$-14/8$$ then find the value of Z. (Note: A, B and C are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Product of roots
$$-z/8=-14/8$$
$$z=14$$
hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(6x^{4}+4x^{3}=kx^{2}+2x+5)$$, If $$AB+BC+CD+AD+BD=\frac{1}{2}$$, then find the value of 'k'. (Note: A, B, C and D are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$AB+BC+CD+AD+BD=c/a$$
$$1/2=-k/6$$
$$k=-3$$
Hence, option E is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(px^{4}+4x^{3}=kx^{2}+2x+5)$$ If sum of A, B, C and D are $$-2/3$$, then find the value of 'p'. (Note: A, B, C and D are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$A+B+C+D=-b/a$$
$$-2/3=-4/p$$
$$p=6$$
Hence, option A is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(6x^{4}+4x^{3}=kx^{2}+qx+5)$$, If $$ABC+ACD+ABD+BCD=-1/3$$, then find the value of 'q'. (Note: A, B, C and D are the roots of the equation)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$ABC+ACD+ABD+BCD=-d/a$$
$$-1/3=-(-q)/6$$
$$q=-2$$
hence, option E is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equations and answer the questions based on them:
In Equation $$(6x^{4}+4x^{3}=kx^{2}+qx+e)$$, If product of A, B, C and D is $$5/6$$ then find the value of 'e'. (Note: A, B, C and D are the roots of the equation) ('e' is constant)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$ABCD=e/a$$
$$5/6=-e/6$$
$$e=-5$$
Hence, option B is correct.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
$$x^{2}-15x+T=0$$ has two roots m and n whose difference is 1. $$(m>n)$$ 

Q38) Find the value of (T+4)
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
Sum of roots = m+n=15
$$m-n=1$$
$$m=8$$ as m>n
$$n=7$$
$$T=$$ product of roots
$$T=56$$
$$56+4=60$$
Hence the correct option is A.

questions.text: Q39) Find the difference between F and T, if the value of F is equal to square of the value of m.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
$$F=8\times8$$
$$F=64$$
$$T=56$$
Difference = 8
Hence the correct option is C.

questions.text:
Solve the given equation based on the data given below and answer the following questions.
I. $$(x\times x)-6x/2-2x=-36/6$$
II. $$y^{2}-9y=10\times-2$$
III. $$(n^{2}25n^{3})/5n^{3}+14\times2=3\times13n$$
IV. $$z^{2}-30z/2=-4\times14$$

Q40) Find the difference between the larger root of equation 1 and smaller root of equation 2.
questions.solution:
**Solution:**
I. $$(x\times x)-6x/2-2x=-36/6$$
$$x^{2}-5x+6=0$$
$$x=3,2$$
II. $$y^{2}-9y+20=0$$
$$y=5,4$$
III. $$(n^{2}25n^{3})/5n^{3}+14\times2=3\times13n$$
$$5n^{2}-39n+28=0$$
$$n=35/5, 4/5=7, 4/5$$
IV. $$z^{2}-30z/2=-4\times14$$
$$z^{2}-15z+56=0$$
$$z=7,8$$

difference between the larger root of equation I and smaller root of equation II = 4-3=1
Hence the correct option is B.
